abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Technical
            Assistance for Public and Private Provision of
            Infrastructure Project is to assist the Government of
            Indonesia to: 1) assess strategic priorities for reducing
            infrastructure bottlenecks; 2) develop an updated strategy
            for public-private partnerships and suitable frameworks for
            private participation in provision of infrastructure
            services; 3) redefine the relative roles of the central and
            local authorities in the identification, preparation and
            implementation of infrastructure projects; and 4) enhance
            program evaluation capability within BAPPENAS National
            Planning Development Agency and regional planning bodies and
            project preparation and implementation capabilities in line
            agencies and local governments responsible for various
            infrastructure investments. The project will support the
            preparation of national sector policies and planning
            studies; strategies to develop institutions and design
            regulation to strengthen public/private partnership in the
            provision of infrastructure services and feasibility
            studies, engineering designs, environmental and resettlement
            assessments and remedial plans. It will also include reviews
            by independent experts of studies as well as unsolicited
            proposals by private investors, and audits of selected major
            assignments to evaluate their impact of institutional
            development. Finally it will finance the training of staff.
